intro: Thlaspeocarpa capensis, commonly known as the Cape thlaspi, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the family Brassicaceae, which includes many economically important crops such as cabbage and mustard. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and is adapted to arid environments. It produces small, white or pale yellow flowers arranged in clusters, and its leaves are usually narrow and fleshy. Thlaspeocarpa capensis is often found in coastal and mountainous regions, where it thrives in well-drained conditions.
